p: For spectral analysis, the data set will undergo multivariate analysis to reduce the spectral dimension and select the optimum wavelengths. Similar to the spectroscopy technique, some examples of multivariate analysis algorithms include PLS, linear discrimination analysis (LDA) [ 35, 36], correlation analysis (CA) [ 50], PCA, ICA [ 41, 51, 52], ANN [ 53], sequential forward selection (SFS) [ 54] and GA [ 55]. These results from multivariate analysis will be used to develop calibration models for calibration, validation and prediction purposes [ 36].
